titleStmt.title: Gädlä Qirqos “Vita of Cyricus” / Täʾamrä Qirqos “Miracles of Cyricus”

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.title: I. Gädlä Qirqos “Vita of Cyricus”
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; names of the protagonists (Qirqos and ʾIyäluṭa); names of the donors. A group of lines alternating with black lines in the incipit page of Texts I and II and in the incipit page of some sections (for the monthly reading) in Text I; the initial two lines of some sections in Text I and of each miracle in Text II; Trinitarian formula; some corrections (words or letters) interlineally. Elements of Ethiopian numerals, of punctuation signs and quire marks; Marginal notes.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 5ra: በስመ፡ʼʼ… ንጽሕፍ᎓ በረድኤተ᎓ እግዚአብሔር። ወበሠናይ᎓ ሀብቱ᎓ መጽሐፈ᎓ ገድሉ᎓ ለብፁዕ᎓ ወለቅዱስ᎓ ዘተሰምየ᎓ ማር᎓ ቂርቆስ᎓ ወእሙኒ᎓ ክብርት᎓ ወቅድስት᎓ ወስማ᎓ ኢየሉጣ᎓ ወለተ᎓ ሩት᎓ ዘተኃርየት᎓…Fol. 5ra: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. We write, through the help of the Lord and His good grace, the book of the [spiritual] combat of the blessed and saint who was called Mar Cyricus, and of his mother, glorious and saint, and her name [was] Julitta, daughter of Ruth, whom was chosen…
msItem.explicit: Fol. 101ra, l.7: …ውስተ፡ መንበረ፡ መንግሥቱ፡ ምስሌሁ፨ ወእሙኒ፡ ምስሌሁ፡ ወአርአዮሙ፡ ስነ፡ ሱራሄሃ፡ አዳም፨ በረከቱ፡ ቅድስት፡ ወኃይለ፡ ኪዳኑ፡ ክብርት፨ ወጸሎተ፡ እሙ፡ ቅድስት፡ ወንጽሕት፡ ይኅድር፡ ወያዕርፍ፡ በላዕለ፡ ፍቁራኒሀ፡ ዓመተ፡ ማርያም፡ ወወለተ፡ ጻድቃን፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜ፡Fol. 101ra, l.7: … on the throne of His reign with him. And his mother (was) with him; and the grace of her beautiful brilliance disclosed to them. His blessing is sacred and the might of his testament is glorious. And may the prayer of his mother, saint and pure, dwell and find rest over her beloved ʿAmätä Maryam and Wälättä Ṣadǝqan. For eternity, amen.

listBibl.bibl: EMML no. 430 (1922/32), fols. 104r-112v: “Combat of St. Cyriacus [Gadla Qirqos]”
(EMML II, 150; Church of the Nativity, quarter of Lǝdäta, Addis Abäba).
(EMML II, 364; Church of Qirqos, quarter of Boleʾ, Addis Abäba).
EMML no. 1934 (late 19th or early 20th cent.), fols. 29r-46r: “Martyrdom [gadl wa-semʿ] of Cyriacus and his Mother Julitta”
(EMML V, 420; Monastery of Ḥayq ʾƎsṭifanos, Ambassäl, Wällo).
EMML no. 2514 (1382/88), fols. 126r-133r (in the “Gädlä Samaʿtat”): “Martyrdom of Cyriacus and his mother, Julitta, [Qirqos wa-emmu Iyyaluṭā]
(EMML VII, 10; Church of Astit Kidanä Mǝḥrät, Ankobärr, Shoa).
fols. 2r-20r: “Martyrdom [Gadl wa-semʿ] of Cyriacus and his mother Julitta”;
fols. 42r-61v: “Martyrdom [Gadl wa-samāʿt] of Cyriacus and his mother Julitta”;
(EMML VIII, 283-284; Church of Šäwa Meda Qirqos, Gubbalafto, Yäğğu, Wällo).
(EMML X, 324; Church of Däse Mädḫane ʿAläm, Wällo).
fol. 28: “Martyre de S. Cyr et sa mère Julitta et des onze mille trente-quatre autres martyrs qui suoffrirent du temps du Tribun Alexandre”
fols. 1ra-28vb: “Martyre de l`enfant Cyriaques (Qirqos) et sa mère Juliette (ʾIyalouṭâ)”
fol. 128r (in “Acts of Saints and Martyrs”): “Quiricus, or Cyriacus, and Julitta, ቂርቆስ፡ ወእሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ (16th of Ṭӗr)”
fol. 200r (in “Acts of Saints and Martyrs”): “Quiricus, or Cyriacus, and Julitta (15th of Ṭӗr)”
fol. 84r (in “Acts of Saints and Martyrs”): “Martyrdom of Quiricus, or Cyriacus, and Julitta, ቂርቆስ፡ ወእሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ (15th of Ṭӗr)”
fols. 1r-109v: “The acts of Quiricus, or Cyriacus, ቂርቆስ፡, and Julitta, ኢየሉጣ”
fols. 218r-227r (“Gädlä Samaʿtat”): “ቂርቆስ፡ und seine Mutter ኢየሉጣ፡”
fols. 57ra-80vb “Vita und Zeugnis des hl. Kyriakos und seiner Mutter Julietta (äthiop.: Iyaluṭā)”

msItem.title: II. Täʾamrä Qirqos “Miracles of Cyricus”
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; names of the protagonists (Qirqos and ʾIyäluṭa); names of the donors. A group of lines alternating with black lines in the incipit page of Texts I and II and in the incipit page of some sections (for the monthly reading) in Text I; the initial two lines of some sections in Text I and of each miracle in Text II; Trinitarian formula; some corrections (words or letters) interlineally. Elements of Ethiopian numerals, of punctuation signs and quire marks; Marginal notes.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 105ra: (Introduction) በስመ፡ʼʼ… ንዌጥን፡ በረድኤተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ጽሒፈ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ማር፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወልደ፡ ቅድስት፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቅርቱ፡ ወለተ፡ ጻድቃን፡ ለዓ[፡] ለዓመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ ስምዑ፡ ንንግርክሙ፡ ዘገብረ፡ ተአምረ፡ ወመንክረ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ማር፡ ቂርቆስ፡ በዕለተ፡ ልደቱ፨ (I Miracle) ወነበረ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ ዘአኃዞ፡ ጋኔን፨…Fol. 105ra (Miracle 1): In the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, one God. We begin with the help of the Lord the writing of the book of the miracles of saint Mar Cyricus, son of saint Julitta. May his prayer and his blessing be with his beloved Wälättä Ṣadǝqan, for the eternity, amen. Listen, we tell you how saint Mar Cyricus worked miracles and wonders on the day of his birth. And there was one man who was posessed by a demon…
msItem.explicit: Fol. 137ra, l.6: (Miracle 33) … ወውእቱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ቀደሳ፡ ለይእቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ እስመ፡ ንጹሕ፡ ውእቱ፡ እምኵሎሙ፡ ነገሥት። ወነበረ፡ እንዘ፡ ይቄድስ፡ እስከ፡ ዕለተ፡ ሞቱ። ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁሩ፡ ገብረ፡ ጽዮን፡ ወምስለ፡ ፍቅርቱ፡ ወለተ፡ ጻድቃን፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ፨ ፨ ፨ ፨ ፨Fol. 137r, l.6: (Miracle 33) ... And that king consecrated that church because he [was] pure among all the kings. And he lived sanctifying until the day of his death. May his prayer and his blessing be with his beloved Wälättä Ṣadǝqan. For eternity, amen.

listBibl.bibl: (EMML II, 4; Church of St. Raphael, quarter of Guläle, Addis Abäba).
(EMML II, 364; Church of Qirqos, quarter of Boleʾ, Addis Abäba).
(EMML VIII, 283-284; Church of Šäwa Meda Qirqos, Gubbalafto, Yäğğu, Wällo).
(EMML X, 324; Church of Däse Mädḫane ʿAläm, Wällo).

note.p: II-1) St. Cyricus and the man possessed by a demon (fols. 105ra-105va) (በስመ፡’’… ንዌጥን፡ በረድኤተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ጽሒፈ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ማር፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወልደ፡ ቅድስት፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ ... ወነበረ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ ዘአኃዞ፡ ጋኔን፨ ወያሴውኖ፡…)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 74ra-74rb).
II-2) St. Julitta and St. Micheal (fols. 105va-106rb) (ተአምሪሃ፡ ለቅድስት፡ ወንጽሕት፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ … ወእንዘ፡ ሀለወት፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ አቡሃ፡ ወፈቀደ፡ ከመ፡ ያውስባ፡ እስመ፡ ...)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 74rb-74va, andUM-008, fols. 34va-35ra. In these Mss. the name of the archangel is Gabriel).
II-3) St. Cyricus and Qade the infedel merchant (fols. 106rb-107vb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ ጸሎቱ፡ … ወነበረ፡ ፩አረማዊ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ቃዴ፡ ወነጋዲ፡ ውእቱ፨ ወእንዘ፡ የኃልፍ፡ ፍኖተ፡ … )
(cp.UM-009, fols. 74va-75va).
II-4) St. Cyricus and the woman who liked the adultery (fols. 107vb-109rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ … ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ መፍቀሪተ፡ ዝሙት፡ ወሰዓሪተ፡ በዓላት፡ ዓበይት፨…)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 75va-76ra).
II-5) St. Cyricus and the man who had neither clothes no food (fols. 109rb-110rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ … ወነበረ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ ነዳይ፡ ዘአልቦቱ፡ ልብስ፡ ወሲሳይ። ወሖረ፡ ኀበ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያኑ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … )
(cp.UM-009, fols. 76ra-76vb).
II-6) St. Cyricus and the man who was making the good (fols. 110rb-111rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለማር፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ … ወነበረ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ ዘይገብር፡ ሠናየ፡ ላዕለ፡ ኄራን፡ ወእኩያን፨ ...)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 76vb-77va).
II-7) St. Cyricus and the infidel who was a thief (fols. 111rb-112va) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ማር፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ … ወነበረ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ ውሁደ፡ አእምሮ፡ ዘአልቦቱ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ወይሴሰይ፡ በሰርቅ፨ ወአማሰነ፡ …)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 77va-78ra).
II-8) St. Cyricus and the adulteress who was married many times (fols. 112va-113rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ማር፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ … ወነበረ፡[sic] አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ መፍቀሪተ፡ ዝሙት። ወትትወሰብ፡ ለለዕለቱ፡ ቦ፵ወቦ፵እምብዝኃ፡ ዝሙት፡ ረሰይዋ፡ አጋንንት፡ …)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 78ra-78va).

II-9) St. Cyricus and the demons, in the region of May Ḍaˤada (fols. 113rb-115rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ማር፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወእንዘ፡ ሀለወ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገር፡ ዘትሰመይ፡ ማይ፡ ፀዓዳ፡ ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ መሰግልት፡ በውስቴቱ፡ ለውእቱ፡ መካን፡ ወትስኅብ፡ አጋንንት፡...)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 78va-79va).
II-10) St. Cyricus and the man who was near death (fols. 115rb-115vb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወሀሎ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ ወአልጸቀ፡ ለመዊት፡ ወሰአልዎ፡ ለውእቱ፡ ብእእሲ፡[sic] እንዘ፡ ይብሉ፡ …)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 79va-79vb).
II-11) St. Cyricus and the infidel horseman who was adversary of another horseman (fols. 116ra-116va) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወነበረ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ መስተቃሕው፡ ወመስተፅዕነ፡ ፈረስ፡ ውእቱ። ወተቃሐወ፡ አሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ምስለ፡ ሰብእ፡ ዘአፍራስ።…)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 79vb-80ra).

II-12) St. Cyricus and the man who loved the love of the world (fols. 116vb-117vb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወአመ፡ ቀዳሚ፡ ገብረ፡ ተአምረ፡ እንዘ፡ ሀለወ፡ ውስተ፡ ፍኖት፡ ርእየ፡ አቡነ፡ ብፁዓዊ፡ ወቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ ዘከመ፡ አፍቀረ፡ ዓለም፡ ምሱን።...)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 80ra-80v. InAMQ-007the word “love” [fǝqr] is omitted).
II-13) St. Cyricus and the woman who had no husband (fols. 117vb-118vb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወነበረት፡ አሐቲ፡ መበለት፡ እንዘ፡ ትገብር፡ ተዝካሮሙ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወለእሙ፡ ለቅድስት፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ …)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 80vb-81ra, and alsoAMQ-012, fols. 62rb-65ra).

II-14) St. Cyricus and the adulteress with whom no one could be compared in adultery (fols. 118vb-120rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ማር፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ መፍቀሪተ፡ ዝሙት፨ ወአልቦ፡ ዘይትማሰላ፡ በገቢረ፡ ዝሙት፡ ወበገቢረ፡ ኃጢአት፨ …)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 81ra-82ra).
II-15) St. Cyricus and the presbyter (fols. 120rb-123vb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ማር፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወኮነ፡ አመ፡ በዓሉ፡ ለማር፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወሀለወ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ ወአሀለቀ፡ ወወሀበ፡ ንዋየ፡ ለነዳያን፡ ወለምስኪናን፡ አመ፡ ዕለተ፡ በዓሉ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ማር፡ ቂርቆስ፡ …)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 82ra-83va).

II-16) St. Cyricus and the adulterer who separated from his wife (fols. 123vb-124va) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወነበረ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ዝሙት፡ ወመሐሊ፡ በሐዕት፨ ዘኢይፈርሆ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወኢየአምሮ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሕፃን፡ ውርዘወ፡ ገድል፨ ወዝንቱ፡ ብእሲ፡ የሐውር፡ ብእሲተ፡ ብእሲ፨…)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 83va-83vb).
II-17) St. Cyricus and the sick man in the country of “ʾAnǝziz” (fols. 124va-125rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወሀሎ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ ድዉይ፡ በሀገረ፡ አንዚዝ፡ ወወእቱ፡ ድዉይ፡ ስኩብ፡ ላዕለ፡ ዓራት፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ፩ንቦሁ፡ ኢይነውም፡…).

II-18) St. Cyricus and the man in the insland of “ʾAngebena”, the Saint`s native land (fols. 125rb-126rb) (ተአምሪሆሙ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወዘእሙ፡ ቅድስት፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ … ወሀሎ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ በደሴተ፡ በሕረ፡ አንጌቤና፡ እንተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ምድረ፡ ሙላደ፡ ሥጋሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፨ …).
II-19) St. Cyricus, St. Julitta, and the governor ʾArmatyanos (fols. 126rb-127va) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወሀሎ፡ ፩መኰንን፡ በውስተ፡ ሀገረ፡ እስያ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አርማትያኖስ፨…).
II-20) St. Cyricus and the monk from a remote region (fols. 127va-128va) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወሀሎ፡ ፩ዘመጽአ፡ እምርኁቅ፡ ብሔር፡ ዘይትአመን፡ በረድኤተ፡ ወይትመሐፀን፡ በኪዳኑ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ …)

(S. Grébaut, “Un nouveau recueil des miracles de l`enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 85-86, 88-89 // Mss. EMML no. 4816, fol. 60v, EMML X, 324; Éthiopien 339, fols. 30rb-31vb, GrébGriaule II, 4-5. Cp. alsoUM-009, fols. 85ra-85va, andAMQ-012, fols. 47va-50va. InAMQ-007the word “monk” is missing).

II-21) St. Cyricus and the sterile couple who was supplicating to the saint for getting a baby (fols. 128vb-129rb) (ተአምሪሆሙ፡[sic] ቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕቱ፡ … ወሀሎ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ መሃይምን፡ ወብእሲሁ፡ መካን፨ ወሀለወት፡ በውስተ፡ ብሔሮሙ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፨ በስመ፡ ሰማዕት፡ ቂርቆስ፡ መስተጋድል፡ ወይገይሱ፡ በኀቤሁ፡ መዓልተ፡ ወሌሊተ፨ ወይስእልዎ፡ ብዙኃ፡ መዋዕለ፡ ከመ፡ የሀቦሙ፡ ወልደ፨ ...)

(S. Grébaut, “Un nouveau recueil des miracles de l`enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 86-87, 89-90 // Mss. EMML no. 4816, fol. 61v, EMML X, 324; Éthiopien 339, fols. 31vb-32vb, GrébGriaule II, 5. Cp. alsoUM-009, fols. 85va-85vb, andAMQ-012, fols. 50va-52rb).
II-22) St. Cyricus and the monk ʾElyas (fols. 129rb-130rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወነበረ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ በደሴተ፡ ፃና፡ ዘስሙ፡ ኤልያስ፡ ዘይትለአክ፡ ወትረ፡ ለታቦተ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ …)

(S. Grébaut, “Un noveau recueil des miracles de l`enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 87-91 // Mss. EMML no. 3469, fol. 22r, EMML VIII, 283; EMML no. 4816, fol. 62v, EMML X, 324; Éthiopien 339, fols. 32vb-33vb, GrébGriaule II, 5. Cp. alsoUM-009, fols. 85vb-86rb;UM-008, fols. 35ra-36ra;AMQ-012, fols. 52rb-55rb).

II-23) St. Cyricus and the man with the impure spirit (fols. 130rb-130vb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወአመ፡ ተፈጸመ፡ ሕፃ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያኑ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ዘፅኑዕ፡ ወኃያል፡ በኀበ፡ ኵሉ፨ ወአብኡ፡ ቍርባነ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፨ ወእንዘ፡ ሀለዉ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፨ አምጽኡ፡ ብእሴ፡ ዘመንፈስ፡ ርኩስ፡ …)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 86rb-86va).
II-24) St. Cyricus and the paralytic (fols. 130vb-132ra) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወሀሎ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ መፃጕዕ፡ እምከርሠ፡ እሙ፡ ወእምአመ፡ ተወልደ፡ ኢሖረ፡ ወይነብር፡ ኀበ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡…)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 86va-87ra).
II-25) St. Cyricus and the man from Egypt (fol. 132ra-rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወሶበ፡ ስምዑ፡ ሰብአ፡ ግብጽ፡ ተአምራተ፡ ወመንክራተ፡ ዘገብረ፡ በውስተ፡ መርጡሉ፡ በሀገረ፡ ወበሐውርት፡ በዘይመጽኡ፡ ኀቤሁ፡ በባሕር፡ ወበየብስ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወአረሚ፨ … )
(Cp. Ms.UM-009, fols. 88ra-88rb).
II-26) St. Cyricus and the man in a region with a building on the insland (fols. 132rb-133ra) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወሀሎ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እንተ፡ ተሐፀት፡ ማእከለ፡ ደሴት፡ ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ቦኡ፡ ውስተ፡ መርጡሉ፡ ለሕፃን፡…)
(Cp.UM-009, fols. 88ra-88rb).
II-27) St. Cyricus and the evil man (fols. 133ra-133va) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ወለብፁዕ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወሀሎ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፨ ወእኩይ፡ ውእቱ፡ ብእሲሁ፡ ወኮነ፡ ይጸልኦ፡ ሰማዕት፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ...)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 89ra- 89rb).
II-28) St. Cyricus and the pagan woman (fols. 133va-134rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እንተ፡ ዘከርናሃ፡ ቀዲሙ፡ ወይእቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ አረማዊት፨ ወቦአ፡ ሰይጣን፡ ውስቴታ፡ …)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 89rb-89va).
II-29) St. Cyricus and the man who wanted to take a wife (fols. 134rb-135rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወሀለዉ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ብእሲ፡ ወብእሲት፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወፈቀደ፡ ያውስብ፡ ብእሲተ፡ ወአስተጋብአ፡ ብዙኃ፡ ሰብአ፨ ...)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 89va- 90ra).
II-30) St. Cyricus and the bishop (fols. 135rb-135vb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወሀለወ፡ ቤቱ፡ ለኤጲስቆጶስ፡ በውስተ፡ ዴዴ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፨ ወበአሐቲ፡ ዕለት፡ ረሥዑ፡ ዓፂወ፡ ኖኅት፡...)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 90ra-90rb).
II-31) St. Cyricus saved the house of a monk from fire (fols. 135vb-136ra) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለማር፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወበ፩እመዋዕል፡ አውአየ፡ ቤቶ፡ ለ፩ብእሲ፡ እሳት፡ ለ፩ወበጎሩ፡ ሀሎ፡ መነኮስ፡ ወተመይጠ፡ …)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 91ra-90rb).
II-32) St. Cyricus and the pagans who waged a war against Christians (fols. 136ra-136rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወኮነ፡ ፩በአሐቲ፡ ዕለት፡ እመዋዕል፡ ወፅኡ፡ አረሚ፡ ከመ፡ ይፅብኡ፡ ክርስቲያነ፡ ወርእዮ፡ ለ፩መኰንን፡ ዘቦቱ፡ ብዙኅ፨…)
(cp.UM-009, fols. 91ra-91rb, andAMQ-012, fols. 69va-71va).
II-33) St. Cyricus and King in the region of “Rome” (fols. 136rb-137rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ … ወሀሎ፡ ፩ንጉሥ፡ ወካህን፡ ወጻድቅ፡ ዘተወክፈ፡ ሢመተ፡ እምአምላክ፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮሜ፡ ቅድስት፨ ...)

(S. Grébaut, “Un nouveau recueil des miracles de l`enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 33-36 // Mss. EMML no. 4816, fol. 59v, EMML X, 324; Éthiopien 339, fols. 28vb-30rb, GrébGriaule II, 4. The same miracle as inUM-008, fols. 23ra-24rb, in which the name of the king, Yǝmrǝḥannä Krǝstos, is included, and as inUM-009, fols. 84rb-84vb. Cp. alsoAMQ-012, fols. 45ra-47va; inAMQ-007, as inUM-009, instead of “Roha” it is written “Rome”).

msItem.note: - In Text II, the miracles were originally not numbered; numbers in pen are inserted in a recent hand, next to each of the miracles.

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 140.0 folios, of which blank 1r-v, 101rb, 138r-140v, in 19.0 quires (A + 18).
31.5 25.2 9.0

collation.signatures:
Decorated - Finely decorated and undecorated quire marks are written in the upper margin, some of them twice or thrice (in the same hand as the donors' names and names of the months), on fols.: 21r: ፫; 29r: ፬; 37r: ፭; 45r: ፮; 61r: ፰; 69r: ፱; 77r: ፲.
Decorated with interlaces are quire marks on fols. fol. 21r, 29r, 45r, 61r (interlaces and anthropomorphic motif).

supportDesc.condition: The Ms. is in good condition. Some fols. have holes (esp. fols. 20, 82, 130, 134); some leaves are repared by stitching (esp. fols. 34, 36, 51, 52, 71, 72, 75, 89, 90, 97, 98, 99, 106, 109, 110, 121, 128). The fols. 5r and 105r bear red and yellow spots, evidently coming from the ink used for the miniatures (fols. 4v, 104v).

layout.ab: Primary pricks are partly visible (s. fols. 17r, 18r).
The upper line is written above the ruling (below on fols. 5r, 8v, 105r).
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Fols. 14r-15v have an additional ruled line in the upper margin.
The scribe disregarded the ruling on fols. 86r-91v (text written outside the layout in the upper margin).

list.item: Short line with dots above and below (esp. fol. 30va, l.2).
II. Four dot asterisk (used throughout the text);
nine dot asterisk (used throughout the text);
doubled nine red dot asterisks (esp. fols.: 78vb, l.7, 124va, l.10, 125rb, l.3, 126va, l.3);
three nine dot asterisks (esp. fols.: 36vb, l.20, 96ra, l.13, 75ra, l.11, 112va, l.7, 123vb, l.16, 126rb, l.18, 135vb, l.1);
four nine dot asterisks (esp. fols.: 8rb, l.21, 84rb, l.14, 128va, l.21, 134rb, l.9);
chain of black and red rot dots (esp. fols.: 14vb, l.6, 52vb, l.21, 96ra, l.3, 124va, l.11);

handNote.seg: Black; red (brilliant crimson for some names in the supplication formulas)..

handDesc.handNote: The hand is characterized by finely rounded, curved and nearly upright letters.
- hairlines at the top of some letters (e.g., በ ወ ይ);
- ስ in the 6th order can be easily mistaken with its 1st order (ሰ);

decoNote.desc: simple, narrow, uncoloured (red), horizontal ornamental band with three extensions (geometric motifs; interlaces).
elaborated coloured (red, yellow, blue, rose, green) horizontal ornamental band with central and lateral extensions (geometric motifs; interlaces).

list.item: Fol. 137rb: List of the donors (?).Fol. 137rb: ወልደ፡ ሩፋኤል፡ ዓመተ፡ ማርያም፡ ወለተ፡ ጻድቃን፡ ወለተ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ ዓሜን፡ ዘሰረቆ፡ ወዘፈሐቆ፡ ውጉዝ፡ ለኩን፡ በስልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ Fol. 137rb: Wäldä Rufaʾel, ʿAmätä Maryam, Wälättä Ṣadǝqan, Wälättä Mikaʾel. Forever and ever, Amen. May the one who stole it and who erased be excommunicated by the authority of Peter and Paul. The note is written in a recent note, in pen.

- Corrections (words or letters) written interlineally (in red or black): e.g., fols. 9ra, 9rb, 14va, 36rb, 37vb, 48rb, 121ra. - Crude notes in pen, sometimes hardly intelligible, are written in the upper margin of fols.: 8v, 12v, 30v, 32r, 34v, 36v, 69v, 70r, 95r, 98v, 99v, 109v, 110v, 118r, 120v, 123r. - Numbers are written in recent hand, in pen, next to each miracle in Text II.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather, textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Slit-braid endband is made of leather strips of two colours, reddish brown and green. Chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.
Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 6 tools were used: cross hatching, double circle, single line fillet, triple line fillet, x-form, triple sine wave).

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: The names Wäldä Rufaʾel (e.g., fol. 8rb), ʿAmätä Maryam (e.g., fol. 52vb), Wälättä Ṣadǝqan (e.g., fol. 5ra), Gäbrä Ṣǝyon (e.g., fol. 25va), ʿAmätä Mikaʾel have been inserted in a later hand in the supplication formulas, sometimes in place of other names which were erased (cp. some of these names also in Additio 1).

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
